citation.article-title: Natronobacterium gen. nov. and Natronococcus gen. nov., two new genera of haloalkaliphilic archaebacteria.

p.s: Natronobacterium gregoryi (gre.go.ry'i. M.L.gen.n. of proper name Gregory: Scottish geologist J. W. Gregory who first described the geology of the African Rift Valley)
Cells long, filamentous rods 0.5-0.7 μm by 10-15 μm in liquid culture, spherical on solid media (1-1.5 μm diameter).
Cells lyse in hypotonic solutions (<1.5 M NaCl).
Alkaliphilic with obligate requirement for sodium carbonate and pH of at least 8.5, optimum 9.5.
On solid media colonies are 2-4 mm in diameter, circular, flat, friable and red.
Utilizes a range of sugars including ribose, fructose, glucose, mannitol and sucrose.
Gelatin is liquefied, does not reduce nitrates or nitrites.
G + C content of DNA is 65.0 mol% (buoyant density), does not possess any minor DNA component or plasmid.
Type strain: SP2 deposited as Natronobacterium gregoryi with NCMB (Tindall, 1980; Ross et al., 1981) as NCMB 2189.
